title: @Riot let me make one thing clear...
body:
When I queue up for a one for all game, I don't want to be outvoted by a pre-made because of this stupid majority rule, and most importantly I don't want to be punished for going in solo.

I hope you take this feedback into consideration the next time you release ofa.

replies.body:
TL;DR:
"RIOT IM BUTTHURT COS I DIDNT GET MY CHAMP, NOTICE ME"

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ifwLTB9A,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-10-17T23:20:29.757+0000)
>
> TL;DR:
> "RIOT IM BUTTHURT COS I DIDNT GET MY CHAMP, NOTICE ME"

so true
To be fair, people shouldn't be allowed to go into an all for one as a 3 man premade and be assured to get their champion.

Not every game is going to have a 3 man pre-made anyway tho, and you could make the argument from the other side too, some guys might really want to play 5 man bard or something, but never get to because the one time they could go pre-made the system chose someone else's pick instead, 

riot can either please 3 people per game and have 2 people annoyed or please 1 person and annoy 4. pretty logical choice if you ask me.

I don't really mind either way tho, I think one for all is a really fun game mode and half the fun is dealing with whatever champ you get given.

That's fair enough, but the point is people shouldn't be able to guarantee they get a particular champion simply by being in a pre-made. Riot could give other people a chance by removing the "majority rule" for pre-mades of 3-4 people who all pick the same champion, so the other 1-2 people who get matched with them still have a chance to get their champion.

While I agree that leaving it as a percentage (at the very least least for three picking the same so the 'majority' is the same as surrenders) I don't quite understand while people get so mad about this game mode. I get that it's fun when you get your champ but, it's basically like ARAM with no rerolls, you have a chance but no guarantee. I understand really wanting to play that one champion just once but if that's the case just keep picking it till you get it and enjoy the other champs along the way. If you really hate a champion make like it and dodge it, noones getting punished for dodging featured gamemodes or ARAMS (as far as I know anyway). 

If you know you're not going to have fun playing a champ, simple, don't play it. And I really don't understand the people that get into games and then only at the end of the game when they're losing go "Oh my god what expletive picked champion %@$#^ idiots". And not to mention the ones that assume the champ you have is weak rather than simply considering the enemy's champ/players is/are stronger. Had that one last night :/ end of the game the two guys who didn't pick it start spouting "Why the #$#@ would you pick Swain he's so stupid" Instead of just considering we were verseing true damage and percentage health galore in 5 Vaynes with 5 BotRKs.....and the fact that it's a featured gamemode and we're just trying to have fun....

> noones getting punished for dodging featured gamemodes or ARAMS

Just an FYI, you get punished for dodging in all matchmade games.

well I said as far as I know (at least I think I did) I don't do it often (and never in SR games/ARAMs, only featured like OFA) and I've never gotten warned for it, so I just figured they didn't for featured gamemode....The more you know I guess

its literally just a toxic aram every damn game. could not think of any situation other than every ofa ive played as to a worse team experience ive been in, and then just altogether they're just shit, including a vlad on my team starting with fucking flask. A FLASK? IS BEING THE GAMES MOST SUSTAINABLE CHAMPION NOT ENOUGH FOR YOU? and whats worse is then when your whole team still buys zhonyas or tank items against an entire team who does 0 damage of the resistance they're buying. but anyway, i think premades are the least of our problems in this mode.
Lol the normals button is right next to the one for all button incase you didn't see. So you're not being forced to play it if you hate it that much.
someones in a good mood today
How would you have that fixed? someone goes in alone and gets to pick and the premade has to deal with it?
No, just make it so pre-mades of 3-4 people can't force a majority.
